ref: 2743 kapala n. ʻ part, half ʼ ŚāṅkhŚr. [Cf. kapaṭī -- f. ʻ measure equal to a double handful ʼ; prob. to be separated from kavala -- , but see EWA i 154 -- 5 with lit.]
P. kaulā m. ʻ part of a wall between two doors ʼ, kaulī f. ʻ armful, embrace ʼ;
H. kaulā m. ʻ side wall, armful ʼ, ˚lī f. ʻ armful, bundle of corn given to village servant ʼ;
M. kavaḷ f.n. ʻ loppings of bushes ʼ, n., kavḷā m. ʻ quantity embraced, armful ʼ.
